project_overview.name: DataServer
project_overview.description: A robust and dynamic server designed to collate and serve live data to a dashboard. The server is built with flexibility in mind, enabling easy changes and additions of new data sources through a loosely-coupled, extensible codebase.
project_overview.architecture: The backend follows Clean Architecture principles with clear separation of concerns across layers. Data flows from external WebSocket APIs through the application and out to consumers via REST API and SignalR for real-time updates.

server.description: The main server application following Clean Architecture

layers.DataServer.Api: HTTP API and SignalR endpoints - wires all layers together
layers.DataServer.Application: Business logic, interfaces, and services that orchestrate data flow
layers.DataServer.Connectors: External data source implementations - designed for extensibility to add new data sources
layers.DataServer.Domain: Core entities and enums with no external dependencies
layers.DataServer.Infrastructure: Caching, logging, and cross-cutting concerns including repository implementations

simulators.description: Contains mock data sources for entirely local deployments. These simulators allow the server to run without connecting to real external APIs, enabling development and testing in isolation.
simulators.purpose: Running deployments with either mock sources or real sources by simply changing configuration files demonstrates the flexibility and loose coupling of the server architecture.

contents.blockchain_api: Mock implementation of the Blockchain.com Exchange WebSocket API for local development and testing

key_design_principles.loose_coupling: Data source implementations are abstracted behind interfaces, allowing new sources to be added without modifying core business logic
key_design_principles.extensibility: The Connectors layer is designed to easily accommodate additional data sources beyond the initial Blockchain.com Exchange integration
key_design_principles.configuration_driven: Switching between mock and real data sources is achieved through configuration changes, not code changes
key_design_principles.clean_architecture: Clear separation between Domain, Application, Infrastructure, Connectors, and API layers ensures maintainability and testability

data_flow.description: External data sources connect via WebSocket, flow through the data source interface implementations in Connectors, are processed by services in Application, stored via repositories in Infrastructure, and exposed to consumers through REST endpoints and SignalR hubs in the API layer
